description: To support the ministry and get access to exclusive content, go to: http://patreon.com/logicalbiblestudy  Luke 17: 11-19 - 'No one has come back to praise God, only this foreigner.'  Catechism of the Catholic Church Paragraphs: - 586 (In 'Jesus & The Temple') - Far from having been hostile to the Temple, where he gave the essential part of his teaching, Jesus was willing to pay the Temple-tax, associating with him Peter, whom he had just made the foundation of his future Church (abbreviated). html_description:
To support the ministry and get access to exclusive content, go to: http://patreon.com/logicalbiblestudy




Luke 17: 11-19 - 'No one has come back to praise God, only this foreigner.'




Catechism of the Catholic Church Paragraphs:


- 586 (In 'Jesus & The Temple') - Far from having been hostile to the Temple, where he gave the essential part of his teaching, Jesus was willing to pay the Temple-tax, associating with him Peter, whom he had just made the foundation of his future Church (abbreviated).




Got a Bible question? Send an email to logicalbiblestudy@gmail.com, and it will be answered in an upcoming episode!


---
Send in a voice message: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/daily-gospel-exegesis/message
name: 28th Sunday in Ordinary Time (Year C) - Luke 17: 11-19
